messages.subject: Re: Re: tasting
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 6/11/2003 2:31:59 AM Eastern Standard Time, ... Yes, that Orange. Also the Lemon. The Lime sounds good too. yum. Kathryn [Non-text portions
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 6/11/2003 2:31:59 AM Eastern Standard Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

> Was it the not-so-sweet Orange you liked? My favorite is Limette, it
> tastes
> like carbonated limeade from my childhood, minus all the wierd pulpy stuff.
> Not at all like American lemon-lime sodas, much sharper. I also like
> Orangina, but that's not a fanta product

Yes, that Orange. Also the Lemon. The Lime sounds good too.

yum.

Kathryn


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re:re: tasting
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 6/10/2003 3:52:24 PM Eastern Standard Time, ... Do you have the yummy Fanta there? We got it in Spain and Portugal (maybe in Morocco...can t
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 6/10/2003 3:52:24 PM Eastern Standard Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

> >I'm a Diet Coke addict, but I hated it in Europe.
>
> It's not diet coke here, it's coca-cola light, and it's gross.
>
> The best part of my invariably long layover at the Charlotte, NC airport is
> that I have time to go to Chili's restaurant (the only one in the airport)
> and order a diet coke and drink several of them. No free refills in Europe,
> either.
>
>

Do you have the yummy Fanta there? We got it in Spain and Portugal (maybe in
Morocco...can't remember). It was SO good.
Kathryn


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]

messages.subject: Re: Re: Re: tasting
messages.msgSnippet: In a message dated 6/10/2003 11:48:16 AM Eastern Standard Time, ... I m a Diet Coke addict, but I hated it in Europe. So we started drinking Fanta in Orange
messages.messageBody:
In a message dated 6/10/2003 11:48:16 AM Eastern Standard Time,
Unschooling-dotcom@yahoogroups.com writes:

> <<Hmmm, maybe that explains why I liked the way Coca-Cola tasted when we
> were
>
> in Tanzania/Kenya, but I don't care much for it here. >>
>
> It's better in England than it is here. Different sweetener.
>

I'm a Diet Coke addict, but I hated it in Europe. So we started drinking
Fanta in Orange and lemon, and it was incredible...kind of like Orangina.

Kathryn
